p: A study shows that the water extract of Ageratum conyzoides L. has a potency to increase the antimalaria activity of chloroquine and artesunate in the plasmodial induced-rats [ 69]. The phytochemical responsible for the antimalarial activities are alkaloid, glycoside, flavonoid, saponin, tannin, and resin. In this study, the leaves extract as well as its fraction show a significant antimalarial activity toward parasite plasmodium as confirmed by in vitro or in vivo model in mice [ 69].
